 I think gay people are more acceptable when they aren't trying to push it on everyone. Gay marriages, unions, whatever you call it, aren't popular right now. The Gay cause has come a long way, but it hit a snag when equal rights for benefits of marriage came into play. I look for you to eventually overcome that. We baby-boomers are coming up, and I think we are the generation you will deal with. We don't care if you are gay.gray, or an other way. Serious. It's the Pope you have to convince.
 
 The gay people who live here ,in my town, are nothing like the cross-dressers and fairys we see on t.v. They don't push it on people. They just go about their business. They live in a small town. Everyone knows who they are. They live as couples. They rent houses .The landlords know they are gay. They buy property, the banks don't care. They are just everyday people.
 
 The gay movement took off too fast. Before you know it ,we are seeing gay men in wedding dresses flashed all over tv. Men dressed as woman, women dressed as men, some dressed half-and-half. I'm thinking, these people want me to allow them the same marriage rights as me? These people want me to vote to allow them to legally get married? They want me to accept them as equals? Not a very good impression.
